DOC.brief_summary: Neuropeptide Y (NPY) may play a major role in the pathophysiology of aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage (aSAH). To investigate the correlation of NPY in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) and blood (serum) and the neurological outcome in the acute stage of aSAH.
DOC.brief_title: Constitution of Cerebrospinal Fluid and Blood Database/Specimen in Acute Stage of Subarachnoid Hemorrhage (aSAH) Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Evaluation of Neuropeptides in CSF and serum in SAH patients
DOC.criteria: spontaneous or aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage age younger than 18 years or older than 70 years inflammatory disease history of former SAH no ventricular drainage
